content_standard: Students apply Historical and Social Sciences Analysis Skills (9â€“12) to gain practical understanding of the legal system, civil rights, and constitutional law.
overview: This course provides students with a practical understanding of the law and the legal system developed under the U.S. Constitution and **Bill of Rights**. Students are encouraged to participate as citizens in the legal process and become aware of current legal issues.

questions: How can the legal system protect civil rights and promote justice in American society?

details: Introduction to the origin and development of the legal system, including civil and criminal law.
Study of the rights guaranteed by the **First, Fourth, Fifth, Sixth, Eighth, and Fourteenth Amendments**.
Analysis of education law, specifically the growing role of the courts in influencing school policy and practice.
Use of mock trials and other simulated legal procedures, along with resource experts, to enhance understanding.
